Message.Msg: Summer rally ended last Friday as I posted. Not too late to go to cash if you are a trader.

Message.Title: JP Morgan Cuts IBM
Message.Msg: EARNINGS estimates... and reduces price target from $218 to $215.... IBM will not reduce EPS estimates. This is a buby opportunity courtesy of JP Morgan... Are you paying attention?
IBM (IBM_) estimates, target reduced at JP Morgan. IBM estimates were cut through 2013, JP Morgan said. Company is leveraged to slower growth overseas. Overweight rating and new $215 price target.
just another reminder.

Topic.Title: High Un-employment, No Growth, Massive Deficits...

Message.Msg: ... who, according to IRS tax statistics, are currently providing 39% of U.S. individual income tax revenues. Obama's tax-the-rich proposals would jump that to almost 45% by most calculations. The bottom 49% of Americans, in the aggregate, pay NO federal income tax... only FICA, which is an old-age "insurance" program. Many of the nation's "super rich" pay a lower tax rate... like Romney's 13.9%. There is a reason for that... ... Most of Romney's income comes from "qualified dividends", which are taxed at a maximum of 15%...Obama would like to raise that to 39%. Is that fair? No, and here's why: The rate was reduced to 15% because dividends are "double taxed" (no, democrats will NEVER mention that)... first at the corporate level at rates as much as 35%, then at the personal (Romney's) level at 15%... ... the total take is as much as 50%. "earned income", however, (what the rest of us working souls make) may often be taxed higher than 15%, but the companies that pay us DEDUCT that compensation, so it is only taxed ONCE. If you compare what Romney and his corporate payor pays to what somebody like Warren Buffett's secretary and her employer pays... ... IT IS A FAR HIGHER RATE! Obama is hoping that the mentality of the people who vote for him won't pick up on that... ... which is why he had Warren Buffett's secretary seated in the front row during the state of the union speech to claim that she was getting SHAFTED compared to Mitt Romney. Hope this helps.
Am gonna subscribe now.

Message.Title: The "Henry Ford" method to fix broken economies
Message.Msg: Henry Ford paid his employees more than he had to so they could buy Ford cars. Until then, autos were mostly seen as a luxury for the rich upper class. Wouldn't it be nice to have some leadership and innovation in the upper echelons of Corporate America again? How about it Corporate America? How about taking a few percentage points of your record profits and use it to pay your existing employees 3% more?

Topic.Title: High Un-employment, No Growth, Massive Deficits...

Message.Msg: First of all, I will just ignore the following blather because it's a BS argument - who cares? If you want to save so much money why don't you become one of the bottom 49% huh? "Start with the Top 1% of Earners who, according to IRS tax statistics, are currently providing 39% of U.S. individual income tax revenues. Obama's tax-the-rich proposals would jump that to almost 45% by most calculations. The bottom 49% of Americans, in the aggregate, pay NO federal income tax... only FICA, which is an old-age "insurance" program." Regarding "double taxing" of qualified dividends, do you feel that people who have enough money to invest should not be taxed on that income? By the way, not too many corporations pay a full 35% tax rate. Do some reading. This will be my last response to your "WOE IS ME I PAY TOO MUCH AND WE'RE ALL GOING TO HE-double hockey sticks IN A HANDBASKET" claptrap.

Topic.Title: High Un-employment, No Growth, Massive Deficits...

Message.Msg: ... and even if you live in a country as we do where there "still" is a lot of capital, you need a government that passes laws that will encourage the DEPLOYMENT of that capital. Your post is pure envy. You hate wealthy people so much that you like the way that Obama taxes the cr@p out of investment capital and gives it to his constituents to take down to WalMart to spend on Chinese stuff. Capitalism is what built the wealth of this country... ... and anti capitalists like Obama are trying to tax capital so badly that it either ends up in China via WalMart... ... or it flees overseas or into tax shelters. The #1 reason for Obama's 8.3% un-employment rate is because nobody will invest in jobs-producing industry. And the reason why nobody will invest in jobs-producing industry is because Obama's anti-capitalism sentiment is so dangerous to those that do. Obama is following the exammple of Venezuela's Hugo Chavez... a man who supports Obama's efforts against capitalism. Raul Castro, who currently rules Cuba is also an avid Obama supporter. C'mon man... THINK... our country is going bankrupt in an ocean of government spending and massive deficits... THINK!

Topic.Title: High Un-employment, No Growth, Massive Deficits...

Message.Msg: ... and I don't call people names. You are not a clown... you are a democrat and most democrats don't support capitalism nowadays. Americans have taken investment capital for granted for so long that they don't understand the value of it any more... ... whereas most other countries do all that they can to attract it away from us and build their economies... ... like the Brazillian facebook founder who took his $3 billion of IPO money and fled to Singapore. Do you know how many American jobs could have been created if he didn't fear Obama so much and had invested that money HERE?

Topic.Title: High Un-employment, No Growth, Massive Deficits...
High Un-employment, No Growth, Massive Deficits...

Message.Msg: Wrong. for some favored industries like biotechnology, the effective federal tax rate is only 4.5%, with the banking and petroleum industries also reporting effective rates of 17.5% and 11.3% respectively. The trucking industry by contrast pays an effective federal tax rate of 30.9 percent.

Message.Msg: IBM is still healthy. The stock is forming the right side of its base, and bounced off its 200 daily moving average. I expect new highs in 2012...
